chapter.title: Domains
chapter.para: The API provides the ability to access user and group information from the organization's directory service using the domains collection. Domain information is referenced with the rel="domains" link.
Each domain contains the following elements:

row.entry: A link to the sub-collection for users associated with this domain
A link to the sub-collection for groups associated with this domain

chapter.para: The links to users and groups sub-collections also accept search queries. See for more information.

example.title: An XML representation of a domain resource
example.screen: <domain id="77696e32-6b38-7268-6576-2e656e676c61" href="/restapi-definition/domains/77696e32-6b38-7268-6576-2e656e676c61"> <name>domain.example.com</name> <link rel="users" href="/restapi-definition/domains/77696e32-6b38-7268-6576-2e656e676c61/users"/> <link rel="groups" href="/restapi-definition/domains/77696e32-6b38-7268-6576-2e656e676c61/groups"/> <link rel="users/search" href="/restapi-definition/domains/77696e32-6b38-7268-6576-2e656e676c61/ users?search={query}"/> <link rel="groups/search" href="/restapi-definition/domains/77696e32-6b38-7268-6576-2e656e676c61/ groups?search={query}"/> </domain>

note.para: The domains collection and its sub-collections are read-only.

section.title: Domain Users Sub-Collection
section.para: The users sub-collection contains all users in the directory service. This information is used to add new users to the Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization environment as per .
A domain user resource contains these main properties:

row.entry: A list of directory service groups for this user
